intro: Trachoma guamense, commonly known as the Guam trachoma, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Guam. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas with sandy soil, adapting to the humid and tropical climate of its native habitat. Trachoma guamense is known for its unique leaf structure, which features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts for its survival.
